title: How to Make a Bottle of Glitter

steps.headline: Make the bottle.
steps.description: Find a suitably sized plastic soda or other plastic drink bottle. Remove the labels (soaking them makes it easier) and clean the inside of the bottle to remove all drink. Ensure that it is completely dried inside before using the bottle.

steps.headline: Fill the bottle with glitter.
steps.description: Leave a small space at the top so that the glitter can move about freely within the bottle when shaken. The glitter can be any size, from ultra-fine to extra-large, as needed.

steps.headline: Add the lid to the top of the bottle.
steps.description: Ensure that it is on tightly.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: The glitter bottle can be used to shake for entertainment and visual appeal or it can be used as a practical item, as the glitter container for your craft projects.

steps.headline: Know what a calming glitter bottle is used for.
steps.description: The idea behind this bottle is that it can either be a source of calming you by staring at it or it can be used for timing a time-out with a misbehaving toddler. Either way, it's a beautiful object to stare at.

steps.headline: Select a suitable bottle.
steps.description: This could be a soda bottle, juice bottle or any other good bottle. It doesn't have to be plastic but if it is to be used by toddlers, plastic is safest. Adults may prefer to use glass, just ensure it is clear glass so that you can see the glitter easily.

steps.headline: Obtain the glitter.
steps.description: You'll need both glitter glue and ultra fine glitter as these two make for the most interesting mixture once added.

steps.headline: Pour in ordinary water to three quarters of the way.
steps.description: Use a funnel to make this easier to do.

steps.headline: Add one bottle of the glitter glue.
steps.description: Add another small container of the ultra fine glitter to complete the glittery look.

steps.headline: Add the lid.
steps.description: Screw on tightly. Give the bottle a shake to check that you're happy with the outcome. If not, add more ultra fine glitter until you like the appearance.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: To use it, simply shake the bottle and watch the swirls that happen. Keep shaking as often as you like, but you should find it a calming experience fairly quickly. To use for a child in time-out, shake the bottle and have them watch it until it settles. Their time-out is over when the bottle settles completely. Or, if the child knocks the bottle over or shakes it, the time-out doesn't end until the glitter has all come to a standstill.

steps.headline: Select seven bottles, one for each color of the rainbow.
steps.description: For this project, it is important that the bottles are all the same size so that they make a neat and consistent group or row of bottles. If you want different sizes, ensure that they match nicely in style and the height differences aren't too disparate. Ensure that the bottle labels are removed, the bottles are cleaned and completely dried.

steps.headline: Make the first bottle.
steps.description: The measurements given are based on a bottle measuring about 600 milliliters (20  fl oz) or a pint. Change the ratios if the container is larger. Pour 3/4 of a cup of the light corn syrup into a see-through measuring cup. The measuring cup must be able to withstand heat, Pyrex makes a good choice. Add 1/2 cup hot water to the corn syrup. Stir to combine. Pour the liquid into the empty bottle.

steps.headline: Repeat for the other six bottles.
steps.description: Do each bottle with the same amount of syrup water.

steps.headline: Add the coloring.
steps.description: For each bottle, add a few drops of glitter liquid watercolor. The glitter will shine through the color added. Have a red, orange, green, yellow, blue, indigo and violet, or variants thereof for the group of colors. You're free to vary this with pastels, ranges of the same hue, or whatever combination pleases you.

steps.headline: Add more glitter.
steps.description: Use glitter of any size and color to add to each bottle. While it'd be best to match the glitter color to the bottle's color, it's not totally essential, as the watercolor glitter will provide the color strength.

steps.headline: Add the lid to each bottle.
steps.description: Secure firmly to ensure the lid stays in place. Shake each bottle around to distribute the glitter through each bottle.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: These can now be used for play or display. If displaying, a row can be interesting, or use as a table setting or place in front of lighting to increase the glow given off. They can also be used in classes for toddlers and youngsters to play games, talk about rainbows or to be used for quiet time.

steps.headline: Choose a suitable bottle.
steps.description: The bottle must have a screw top and it must be clear, but can be either plastic or glass. A shampoo or lotion bottle might work, or even a food bottle if it can be cleaned really well.

steps.headline: Fill the bottle almost full with water.
steps.description: Add a few drops of glycerin to the bottle.

steps.headline: Add metallic confetti to the bottle.
steps.description: Choose metallic confetti with multiple styles and sizes and interesting shapes such as stars and moons, squares and circles, etc. You can still add standard glitter pieces if wished, preferring the larger glitter pieces.

steps.headline: Screw the lids on top.
steps.description: Screw on tightly.

steps.headline: Shake.
steps.description: The metallic confetti will disperse through the bottle and look "magical". This is great for parties, fairy dress-ups and just for fun. They also make great centerpieces for a kid's party.

text: Repurposed Plastic Bottle of Glitter Make the bottle. Find a suitably sized plastic soda or other plastic drink bottle. Remove the labels (soaking them makes it easier) and clean the inside of the bottle to remove all drink. Ensure that it is completely dried inside before using the bottle. Fill the bottle with glitter. Leave a small space at the top so that the glitter can move about freely within the bottle when shaken. The glitter can be any size, from ultra-fine to extra-large, as needed. Add the lid to the top of the bottle. Ensure that it is on tightly. Done. The glitter bottle can be used to shake for entertainment and visual appeal or it can be used as a practical item, as the glitter container for your craft projects. Calming Glitter Bottle Know what a calming glitter bottle is used for. The idea behind this bottle is that it can either be a source of calming you by staring at it or it can be used for timing a time-out with a misbehaving toddler. Either way, it's a beautiful object to stare at. Select a suitable bottle. This could be a soda bottle, juice bottle or any other good bottle. It doesn't have to be plastic but if it is to be used by toddlers, plastic is safest. Adults may prefer to use glass, just ensure it is clear glass so that you can see the glitter easily. Obtain the glitter. You'll need both glitter glue and ultra fine glitter as these two make for the most interesting mixture once added. Pour in ordinary water to three quarters of the way. Use a funnel to make this easier to do. Add one bottle of the glitter glue. Add another small container of the ultra fine glitter to complete the glittery look. Add the lid. Screw on tightly. Give the bottle a shake to check that you're happy with the outcome. If not, add more ultra fine glitter until you like the appearance. Use. To use it, simply shake the bottle and watch the swirls that happen. Keep shaking as often as you like, but you should find it a calming experience fairly quickly. To use for a child in time-out, shake the bottle and have them watch it until it settles. Their time-out is over when the bottle settles completely. Or, if the child knocks the bottle over or shakes it, the time-out doesn't end until the glitter has all come to a standstill. Rainbow Glitter Bottles Select seven bottles, one for each color of the rainbow. For this project, it is important that the bottles are all the same size so that they make a neat and consistent group or row of bottles. If you want different sizes, ensure that they match nicely in style and the height differences aren't too disparate. Ensure that the bottle labels are removed, the bottles are cleaned and completely dried. Make the first bottle. The measurements given are based on a bottle measuring about 600 milliliters (20  fl oz) or a pint. Change the ratios if the container is larger. Pour 3/4 of a cup of the light corn syrup into a see-through measuring cup. The measuring cup must be able to withstand heat, Pyrex makes a good choice. Add 1/2 cup hot water to the corn syrup. Stir to combine. Pour the liquid into the empty bottle. Repeat for the other six bottles. Do each bottle with the same amount of syrup water. Add the coloring. For each bottle, add a few drops of glitter liquid watercolor. The glitter will shine through the color added. Have a red, orange, green, yellow, blue, indigo and violet, or variants thereof for the group of colors. You're free to vary this with pastels, ranges of the same hue, or whatever combination pleases you. Add more glitter. Use glitter of any size and color to add to each bottle. While it'd be best to match the glitter color to the bottle's color, it's not totally essential, as the watercolor glitter will provide the color strength. Add the lid to each bottle. Secure firmly to ensure the lid stays in place. Shake each bottle around to distribute the glitter through each bottle. Done. These can now be used for play or display. If displaying, a row can be interesting, or use as a table setting or place in front of lighting to increase the glow given off. They can also be used in classes for toddlers and youngsters to play games, talk about rainbows or to be used for quiet time. Magic Glitter Bottle Choose a suitable bottle. The bottle must have a screw top and it must be clear, but can be either plastic or glass. A shampoo or lotion bottle might work, or even a food bottle if it can be cleaned really well. Fill the bottle almost full with water. Add a few drops of glycerin to the bottle. Add metallic confetti to the bottle. Choose metallic confetti with multiple styles and sizes and interesting shapes such as stars and moons, squares and circles, etc. You can still add standard glitter pieces if wished, preferring the larger glitter pieces. Screw the lids on top. Screw on tightly. Shake. The metallic confetti will disperse through the bottle and look "magical". This is great for parties, fairy dress-ups and just for fun. They also make great centerpieces for a kid's party. Finished.
